brief_summary.textblock:
Systems for blood glucose monitoring with glucose oxidase enzyme reaction on test strips can
      be affected by the partial pressure of oxygen of the blood sample. In this study, we
      investigate the influence of different partial pressure of oxygen in blood samples on
      measurement results. Systems with labelled oxygen-dependency as well as systems without
      labelled oxygen-dependency are evaluated.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Blood Glucose Monitoring Systems - Evaluation of Oxygen Dependency

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  18 years of age or older

          -  male or female subjects with type 1 or type 2 diabetes or healthy subjects

          -  signed informed consent form

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  pregnancy or lactation period

          -  severe acute illness that, in the opinion of the investigator, might pose additional
             risk to the subject

          -  severe chronic illness that, in the opinion of the investigator, might pose
             additional risk to the subject

intervention.intervention_name: 6 blood glucose monitoring systems for self-testing

facility.name: Institut für Diabetes-Technologie Forschungs- und Entwicklungsgesellschaft an der Universität Ulm

clinical_study.official_title: Prüfung Von Blutzuckermesssystemen - Bewertung Der Sauerstoffabhängigkeit

overall_official.affiliation: Institut für Diabetes-Technologie Forschungs- und Entwicklungsgesellschaft an der Universität Ulm

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the blood sample`s partial pressure on blood glucose measurement results
primary_outcome.time_frame: For each sample, preparation and measurment procedure have an expected duration of about 2 hours

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
